intro: Pholidophyllum zonatum, commonly known as the zoned pholidophyllum, is a rare and enigmatic plant belonging to the family Phyllanthaceae. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring a distinct zonation pattern that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
